intro: Trixis mollissima, commonly known as the silky trixis, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
